comments.commentBody: Rick, according to the evidence, Boy George was more adept at avoiding flying than at flying.  He was AWOL enough that he needed political cover to avoid charges.  Of course he got it, being a Bush (of THAT family).

Yeah, because that makes it right. If our country wasn't so messed up, all the banks that issued mortgages to undeserving people would have gone broke AND all the people who never deserved the loans and couldn't afford them would have lost their homes.

Instead, millions of people lost their homes, others scrimped and sacrificed so they wouldn't, and a few dirtbags like the ones in this article used our legal schenanigans to get homes they don't deserve.

And there is always, always going to be someone like you who thinks that that somehow when a dirtbag finds a loophole, it's a great day just because they are "sticking it to the man".

Interesting. I owned a house in NC, and when I was 3 months late on a payment, BofA put the house in foreclosure faster than you could say "jack rabbit." I offered to make up the payment, but they refused to accept it. It's amazing that some people could fall through the cracks for 5 years, I didn't even get 5 months!
Both BofA and Countrywide - my original mortgage holder - were underhanded and shameless.

Maybe it's time for the banks to quit laying off all of the processors in their centers. They laid off many of their laborers and now they can't process basic paperwork?

How about taking a few billion from the "bonus pool for morons who can't do basic math" and hire back the people who actually do the work in the banks. (The bonuses only go to people who don't know how to rate risk or even balance derivatives investments versus the risk of collapsing the entire economy.) When you collapse the entire economy with your actions, you're no longer worthy of a bonus or even an ice cream... unless that's tainted ice cream.

A 5 year statute of limitations will probably be "modified" by the banks due to some sneaky forward dating scheme they come up with. Banks have no limits to the crimes they're willing to commit. Money laundering, financing murders, financing terrorism, financing rogue nations, financing drug lords, financing kidnappings, financing the sex trade, human trafficking, stealing homes from people, destroying the retirements of hundreds of millions of people....

After 2008, the banks can do no amount of penance to earn back what they stole from us. More people have committed suicide and died early from stress from what Wall Street bankers did than any terror group has ever even considered killing.

And in two decades what predator do we introduce to control the cougar population?
Wonder how a mountain lion roast with shallots would taste?
The coyotes are doing a culling job here- take care of cats and small dogs too- geese are also good to go!

Reintroducing the cougar is an interesting alternative!
We see the deer by the herds and read police reports about wildcat sightings, and we also have coyotes and large raptors visiting the back yard. It's true, the deer will eat almost anything that grows except, as some readers have noted, rosemary, lavender and, I can add, sage, thyme, and oleander; and they love stale tortillas and bread meant for the birds and dropped far from the house. We give chase -- more cautiously in the case of the big bucks -- when they get too close to the house. I was sorely tempted to free a young buck who got caught in a thicket, in plain view of my living room, a couple of years ago. One can't help but think, at such times, of a young ram on the other side of the world who found himself in a similar predicament thousands of years ago and who might have been quite delicious grilled with the aforementioned herbs; but my wife forbade me to help him, which was certainly a good thing for my longevity. After he freed himself, I spent a few moments with a hand saw and pruning hook and haven't seen anybody caught in the same place since.
Local lore (in the neighborhood) is that our Mexican Mule Deer will jump a 14-foot fence if they're being chased by a mountain lion, and we hear that lyme disease is relatively uncommon west of the Rockies.

Rats on hooves! Urbanites moon over big-eyed does while the rest of us try to figure out how to keep them from eating absolutely everything in our landscapes. They don't like junipers and piñons, everything else is vulnerable.

Their depredation is exacerbated by five years of NM drought which has reduced the nutritional support in their normal habitats, so they eat up our plantings instead.

The elimination of their predators nationwide has allowed deer to proliferate enormously, causing road collisions, widespread habitat destruction, etc.

One has to have been on the other end of the game to appreciate the unequal nature of the lender to the homeowner. The S&L crisis had many of us inside some sort of hampster wheel while the loan was transferred many times and 'games' by some of the servicers were implemented to actually inspire foreclosure, create phony late charges through paper games and mailing games in and outbound and even to create phony escrows for taxes not a part of the loan. During the next 10 years the lenders service outfit managed to create for itself thousands of fees or errors (such as paying taxes not due as valuation was reduced), while loading all the costs onto the borrower.

These outfits are not the bankers who originated the loan or had the relationship. They are in some cases the worst sort of folks who create a climate of fear or at least frustration and take no responsibilty. In cases of states who don't have court foreclosure the can harm with impunity, like those banksters who put us into this mess. I'll root for this lady in spite of having had to pay through the nose. This mess need not have happened but for freeing up the banksters and allowing the games Vs hard working folkls caught in a mess that would have been fixed if local banks were originator, servicer and decision makers.

I don't believe that. Tidal does not have a free tier and that will likely make a big difference to artists on a per play basis.

We shouldn't be so cynical that we reject the possibility of improvement.
Can't stop the signal, Mal.
!QED:  That's precisely the trouble with Scott Walker.

Jay Z is not the only artist to discuss the need for an artists' owned distribution network. The reality is interactive music streaming, foisted on the industry by Spotify with the consent of the major recording labels, is a dead zone for artists with no way to climb out of the loss of earnings from cratering recorded music sales.

Music has been free for so long that unless artists get a handle on their own industry their future is non-existent.

how will this help artist like Aretha Franklins who's new Cd got no air play but is off the chain with hits Remix Rollin in The Deep  Alicia Keys No One in Which Aretha does Reggae Style she's The Queen of All Soul Music and like These Legends are being disrespected and they Paved the way for The artist today  Aretha needs to be heard like James Brown everyday ???

When computers stop doing the job for this so called "artist" then I will pay for music. Lip syncing and having a computer program fix your voice is not a talent. In a way, the same industry has killed many real artists my fixing the voices untalented people.

I laugh everytime Taylor Swift et al. refer to themselves as "artists." Kinda like those "reverends " like Sharpton or "Doctor so & so" when.the doc is has an education degree from one of those daytime tv promoted "universities."
Anyway, like it was noted easirt "meet new boss same as old boss."
anytime that the elites of any industry meet, in the long run, it has rarely benefited the poor...just another smoke screen.

First let me say congrats on buying Tidal. Good move. More control of what happens with your music. I see no problems with a move like that because all of your fans will follow. See it's not just about music. Its about how the artist feels about the way their work is being released into the world and if they are compensated for their work the way they feel they should be compensated. Some of you just hear music and what they are singing. When I listen I can feel the work that was put in to making music. From the bass track all the way to the vocals and if I listen long enough I can hear each layer of the music by itself. I love music so much that my car stereo can be nice and quiet or loud enough to upset the neighbors. I gotta pay attention to Tidal why? because of the new owners and because I love their music. The company is owned by people who make the music I listen to. Some times I sit in my car all day just listening to music trying to relax and yes it does work.
you need the lifestraw...google it..
@QED:  Very snarky.  Rather nasty.

Mindless avarice for "artists."  (Do those folks really believe their shills- I read somewhere you can buy "followers" on whatever internet app, in units of a million..So when.E! tells us that its frankenstein the Kardashians have "millions of followers" be advised. I really feared  for our cultural future.

The problem is that because of the poorly written Digital Millennium Copyright Act,  music is still available for free from many sites.  The "Safe Harbor " provision has allowed technology companies and piracy businesses to make a business model that relies on essentially giving away music for free while paying the creator's nothing.    You Tube  is perhaps the biggest offender.   They created a platform that encourages users to upload pirated works and profits in the same manner as if they gave it away themselves. They have admitted to 180 million take down's per year.  Now in a market, the lowest price sets the going rate for any good.  And in this case that is $0.  So I do admire this effort by Tidal but  as long as CR laws remain unchanged I don't see them accomplishing what they expect.  If they try to pay artists fairly they would be undercut by the other services that are operating on the lowest margins attempting to compete with "free."

You can buy a cd with well over one hundred songs in Latin America for less than $1. These "artisits" need to quit whining about piracy etc and keep with the "concert as money maker " model. In the long run, because contemporary "music" is such forgettable dreck,. the only offerring for which they can obtain easy pay is the writhing around the stage while making 20 costume changes.

There are plenty of recorded works that are done without auto tune or similar programs.  And many of those that have started using computer programs like you describe only did it because with people taking work for free you cannot afford to take the time to do things right. In the days when people paid for music  there was much more time taken to make an album. You would  go back and correct imperfections, over and over.  The truth of the matter is  if people can take something for free, they will.  And there are a plethora of supposed justifications for that.  Could it be that people just like "free?"
Actually millions support the new law. Even Putin called the Indiana governor and congratulated him on it. What you say?

What the latest developments in Indiana show us, is that we have democracy, but we don't have representative democracy.  Our political class does not accurately represent the demographically accurate political views of the country.  Specifically, the GOP has used many anti-democratic measures to overcome their inherent minority position of representing the elite capital class and has been in a tight political relationship with evangelicals for over 100 years.  But GOP views on nearly all issues are only supported by a fervent minority, what the GOP sees as their political base.  It is only this explanation that reveals why all GOP candidates would still support this law, because without evangelicals, they are most certainly doomed.  But their failure in thinking is that vocal hardcore evangelicals are the small minority.  Most people in this country are quite tolerant and do not want to see unjust discrimination meted out in society.  So now the entire GOP is standing on a marginally supported and immoral political position, which can only pound them hard in the next election, maybe to the breaking point.  This should be the topic in the media, the silence of the GOP on this important moral issue of our time, and truly that the GOP will go down on the wrong side of history, in its present constitution.
Actually the cause for most injuries in lacrosse is due to the stick that people wield. My sister plays lacrosse and she'll tell you that most of her injuries are due to "checks" from sticks. Biatch.

@FK: That is a much better way of explaining it than what is given in the article. However, stick/ball-to-head injuries are of course not the only reason for which boys wear helmets; they also get other hits to the head that girls are less likely to get, such as body-to-head collisions, body-to-body collisions that result in hitting their heads on the ground, etc. Therefore, the fact that boys wear helmets doesn't automatically mean that girls should also do so.
Thank you Anna.  You read my mind.  With all the problems in the World today without solutions, this isn't one of them.
Oh for the love of God and all that is holy, it's about time. Just get them some helmets and stop talking about it.
